column1: Labyrinthitis is irritation and swelling of the inner ear.
Labyrinthitis is usually caused by a virus and sometimes by bacteria.
Less often, an ear infection may lead to labyrinthitis.

These factors raise your risk for labyrinthitis: - Drinking large amounts of alcohol - Fatigue - History of allergies - Recent viral illness, respiratory infection, or ear infection - Smoking - Stress - Using certain prescription or nonprescription drugs (such as aspirin)

Symptoms may include any of the following: - Feeling like you are spinning, even when you are still (vertigo) - Your eyes moving on their own, making it hard to focus them - Dizziness - Hearing loss in one ear - Loss of balance;
you may fall toward one side - Nausea and vomiting - Ringing or other noises in your ears (tinnitus)
